description.main: The first edition of the AKAI Code hackathon organized by AKAI - Academic Web Application Research Group - takes place at the Poznań University of Technology.
description.idea: The idea of an event is simple! You code an application related to the topic within 24 hours, and then the jury decides which team will win.
description.categories: There are three categories to compete in - Best Idea, Best Prototype and Best Technology Usage. What's the topic? You'll find out soon!

topic.title: Topic
topic.topic: The theme of the first edition of AKAI Code is "The Social Influence".
topic.topicDescription:
Introduce us to an idea that solves a problem of a small or or larger community that you're part of.
Have an idea on how to support your local food bank? nice! Know how to help an animal shelter in your area? Great! Have you come up with a solution to old lady Jadzia's problem? Let's go!
Find your jumble, take it apart, figure out the solution and at the end shine in front of a jury!

bestIdea.title: Best Idea
bestIdea.description: The most interesting initiative that solves in an interesting and real way the problem of Your community.

bestPrototype.title: Best Prototype
bestPrototype.description: The best implementation of an idea, it means the most accurate way to execute an idea.

bestTechnology.title: Best Technology Usage
bestTechnology.description: The best technical execution of the project - means the best choice of technology, programming, or clever software solutions.

about.title: About us
paragraphs: The first edition of the AKAI Code hackathon organized by AKAI - Akademickie Koło Aplikacji Internetowych - takes place at the Poznań University of Technology.
The idea of an event is simple! You code an application related to the topic within 24 hours and then the jury decides which team will win.
There are three categories to compete in - Best Idea, Best Prototype and Best use of technology. What's the topic? You'll find out soon!

questions.question: Do you need to know how to code?
questions.answer: No! You can make a presentation, mock-up or whatever you want. Just present your idea to the jury.

questions.question: Is there a fee to participate?
Will there be prizes?
questions.answer: Yes, your efforts must be rewarded.

questions.question: Who can participate?
questions.answer: The minimum age of a participant is 15 years old. However, if there is a minor in the team, he or she must have an adult guardian.

questions.question: Can a person from the team be the guardian of a minor?
questions.answer: Yes! The only requirement is that they must be in the same team.

questions.question: Can I be on more than one team?
How many people can be in a team?
questions.answer: A team is from 1 to 6 people, including the captain.

questions.question: We have the team, now what?
questions.answer: The captain must register the team here: <a href="https://samorzad.put.poznan.pl/akai-rejestracja-zespolu" target="_blank">https://samorzad.put.poznan.pl/akai-rejestracja-zespolu<a>.

questions.question: Why do I need to specify the allowance of each member in the application form?
questions.answer: This is an indicative question, which helps us to prepare the appropriate amount of food.

questions.question: Is it possible to change the data after the registration form is approved?
questions.answer: Yes. Just write to us on FB and we will correct everything.

questions.question: How should I prepare for the hackathon?
questions.answer: Equip yourself with a laptop, an account on the Discord platform, warm clothes and a sleeping bag (if you consider sleeping…).

footer.akai: AKAI - Academic Web Application Research Group
